padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2141864" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="edw57553"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1781665"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="edw57553" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2141864ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2141864" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1781665">edw57553</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-01">05/01/24 01:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a suggestion for improvement: It would be great if the voting results were displayed immediately after someone votes for a cologne they like. I believe the actual numbers might be higher than what's currently shown. On another note, I absolutely adore Carlisle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2141864"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2141864#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2141700" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2141700" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rkt"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081222"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="rkt" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.33514.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Carlisle"title="Carlisle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2141700ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2141700" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081222">rkt</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-30">04/30/24 20:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A sweet and long lasting perfume that lasts for 10+ hours. The scent is dark and unique which makes is great for the spring and winter seasons. I would recommend testing it before buying a bottle due to the price tag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2141700"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2141700#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2140102" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2140102" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Andrshtir"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2039291"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Andrshtir" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2140102ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2140102" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2039291">Andrshtir</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-29">04/29/24 10:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On me a beautiful, multifaceted gourmandica! I do not know what it was before, now on me it is persistent with a calm, well-mannered trail, sits softly and not too loud, plays and shimmers, especially in proglady weather, above 10-15 degrees on me is not so beautiful. If you think that you will apply more and it will be more persistent and plume, it is not so, it will become luscious with shades of animalica, it is better not to) 1-2 sprays is quite, on things sits until washing. If you want a perfume from Parfums de Marly, but exactly niche, then you here. This is my subjective opinion. I think that's why some people find Carlisle "so-so" and others "so-so". That's what niche is, it's about complexity. I realized that when I was giving it a good thrashing. It shimmers and plays with facets. More of a gourmand, but not simple, I caught shades of Layton and Herod, light tobacco echoes and chocolate patchouli, like a cake made of dark chocolate, and cherry and cocacoliciousness))))) Interesting work! As always test and decide for yourself</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2140102"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2140102#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2139404" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2139404" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tylerss20"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2085849"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2085849.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tylerss20" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Y-Le-Parfum-64718.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64718.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Y Le Parfum"title="Y Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2139404ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2139404" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2085849">tylerss20</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-28">04/28/24 19:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>An impressive winter fragrance, but there's a warmth that's missing that I think other PdMs have. There's a sharp, almost metallic note in the background and a thinness to this that stops this short of being a great fragrance. Like the original Pegasus, I think there are similar fragrances that offer slightly better formulations that keep Carlisle from being full bottle worthy.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2139404"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2139404#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2138137" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2138137" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="thainan.noronha"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1358269"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1358269.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="thainan.noronha" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2138137ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2138137" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1358269">thainan.noronha</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-27">04/27/24 11:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I consider Carlisle to be the best perfume I've ever encountered from the house. It's the scent I associate with a Byronic hero, possessing two facets: a pleasant and gentle one, and a somber, dark, and mysterious one. First of all, the pyramid here on Fragrantica seems to be incomplete; other places mention more notes. The first aspect, pleasant and luminous, is represented by its floral and sweet nuances, especially formed by the juicy and natural green apple, combined with the floral combo of davana, osmanthus, and rose (which I perceive as a block) and tonka bean and vanilla, bringing a mature yet creamy and smooth sweetness. This combo really brings memories of Layton, hence many people saying that this perfume is a blend of it with other fragrances from the house. Its darker aspect comes from the combination of spices, resins, and woody notes. Here come the nutmeg from the opening, saffron (quite subtle), the base woods: patchouli and sandalwood (which I actually perceive little of), and opoponax, which makes all the difference in this perfume, giving it an incense-like quality. From this base, patchouli predominates in me, in large doses, along with resin, making the perfume juicy and creamy, yet at the same time, earthy and incense-like, reminiscent of something ancient, indeed, also resembling the tobacco accord, although tobacco is not listed in the pyramid.<br />
<br />
In fact, the resemblance to Red Tobacco is immediate, and they are very close perfumes, indeed. Red Tobacco is more spicy, with a colossal load of saffron and cinnamon that persists almost throughout the perfume's life on the skin, it has a heavier woody load due to oud (although I feel less patchouli), and it has better performance, despite being sharper. I believe it would be redundant to have both, and since Red Tobacco costs about less than half the price of Carlisle, perhaps the cost-benefit ratio is better. However, if price is not an issue, Carlisle is a considerably superior perfume, more well-crafted and refined, more rounded.<br />
<br />
It's a perfume of contrasts that harmonize wonderfully well, and it's amazing that the brand can create something so distinctive and, at the same time, so pleasant. I can't imagine this perfume offering any kind of challenge, so it doesn't surprise me that many people outside Brazil consider it the best from the house. I don't consider it a perfume of great developments; the opening is juicy and spicy, and over time the spices tend to recede, and the base emerges, blending with the juicy and floral accord, remaining so until the end of its long life. It projects well for at least about 2.5 hours and lasts for at least about 10 hours. It's totally nocturnal; I don't see it being worn during the day, nor with any clothes, it calls for formal attire. It's a perfume that demands a complex personality to wear, somewhat somber and a certain passion for the old (patchouli gives me that feeling), reminding me of an English countryside landscape with grand castles and cathedrals surrounded by forests in mid-autumn, or even something with a Halloween aura. It's a pleasant, almost gourmand, dense, woody, and dark perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2138137"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2138137#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2137523" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2137523" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Igoham0224"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2039049"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Igoham0224" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2137523ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2137523" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2039049">Igoham0224</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-26">04/26/24 18:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a relatively small collection of 12 fragrances. I do have to say this is by far my favorite one. The woody sweetness of this fragrance is on a different level. The woodiness to this fragrance is what balances it all out. Every time I wear this fragrance, someone asks what I am wearing. I would agree this is more of an evening fragrance, but it can absolutely be worn in the day. This is a fragrance that you have to wear with confidence, or it will absolutely wear you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2137523"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2137523#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2136708" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2136708" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="perfumr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2110434"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="perfumr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2136708ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2136708" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2110434">perfumr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-26">04/26/24 00:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Im surprised no one is comparing this to Tobacco Volute by Latelier Perfume! <br />
I do agree with the comparison to Red Tobacco but the dry down definitely reminds me of Tobacco Volute. <br />
<br />
The perfume does not lean masculine - it is unisex; the dry down is too sweet - the vanilla really stands out here.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2136708"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2136708#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2128681" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2128681" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SH89"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1346337"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="SH89" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2128681ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2128681" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1346337">SH89</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-18">04/18/24 13:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To be honest, I find this quite redundant, as I already have Mancera Red Tabacco,<br />
and although I do slightly prefer this over Red Tabacco, I find it hard to justify the extra cost to get a DNA which I already have.<br />
<br />
But regardless, its a great scent and has very good performance.<br />
Excellent perfumery.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2128681"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2128681#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2124571" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2124571" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jeshuwin"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2094157"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2094157.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jeshuwin" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2124571ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2124571" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2094157">Jeshuwin</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-14">04/14/24 10:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A fragrance masterclass. PDM has some good colognes, but this one is my personal favorite.<br />
<br />
Scent profile is dark, sweet and alluring. Smells like luxurious just like everything else PDM has made, but is a sexy- well-crafted blend. Longevity is great, you get at least 8-12+ hours. <br />
<br />
Very mysterious, masculine. I will warn you though, the bottle I have was an older bottle and I've heard the newer reformulations aren't as good- <br />
<br />
Best used in the fall or winter as the nutmeg, vanilla compliment the season. <br />
<br />
12/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2124571"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2124571#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2124069" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2124069" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="leonardwashington"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826154"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1826154.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="leonardwashington" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2124069ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2124069" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826154">leonardwashington</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-13">04/13/24 19:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Think my bottle has matured. Its definitely taken on a much more deeper/darker profile. This is definitely my top PDM. Between this and Layton. This is definitely great for cooler nights out. It smells mysterious and sexy. I only do two sprays of this. Great performance if you ask me. More masculine leaning. In the opening to me can be little unpleasant. Which only last for a few moments. Then the dark mysterious drydown comes in and thats the magic. I do own Layton, Percival, and Carlisle. But Layton and Carlisle I think are really the two to have.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2124069"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2124069#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123619" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2123619" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ivanthegreat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2094715"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ivanthegreat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2123619ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2123619" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2094715">ivanthegreat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-13">04/13/24 10:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Probably the most standout fragrance in my collection. The average person has never really smelled anything like this before. This stuff is a beast but not in a bad way like Erba Pura or other nukes. Lasts eons on clothes and at least 12 hours on skin. Its dark, mysterious, and has the right amount of gourmand elements (as opposed to something like Angels Share). The gourmand element Im referring to is a hint of apple pie with some cinnamon. This stuff has an insane scent trail that gets compliments. Only knock on this frag is the versatility. Only suitable for fall and winter and if you are wearing it to class or work you really cant put more than one spray otherwise it would fill up the room too much. When I first bought this although I really enjoyed the scent it was slightly nauseating at first because its strong but after 4 wears I got completely used to it and its not nauseating at all anymore.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2123619"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2123619#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123571" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Best patchouli scent in my opinion.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2122233"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2122233#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2121297" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2121297" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Swore"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1489447"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1489447.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Swore" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2121297ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2121297" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1489447">Swore</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-11">04/11/24 07:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Carlisle is a 10/10 masterpiece. Unfortunately, the house of PDM is a shitshow and continues to ruin their legacy by letting their quality slip. Every reformulated 81% alc conc bottle is a watered down husk of what was once a series of beautiful scents. This goes for Carlisle, Herod, Layton, etc. <br />
<br />
PDM does not include many of the product details of their previous batches such as the PDM card. PDM is using pre-reform boxes for their reformulated bottles which completely misleads customers of aftermarket dealers who are selling vintage 77% bottles. <br />
<br />
A house that once prided itself on quality is now the epitome of dissatisfaction. 5 stars for Carlisle, zero stars for PDM.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2121297"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2121297#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2120286" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2120286" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Radius"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460748"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1460748.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Radius" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Marc-Antoine-Barrois/Ganymede-54720.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.54720.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ganymede"title="Ganymede"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2120286ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2120286" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1460748">Radius</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-10">04/10/24 07:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>when the warm spice and tobacco notes hits your nose from afar it's alluring.  up close it's a mess.  Dont smell your skin where you applied it, it's one of those sillage-enjoyable wears.  smells like you rip open a pack of Marlboros and smell the top of the filters, you get that tobacco sensation with this one.  At least to me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2120286"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2120286#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2117855" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2117855" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="midget11"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1610562"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="midget11" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.33514.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Carlisle"title="Carlisle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2117855ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2117855" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1610562">midget11</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-08">04/08/24 03:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>COVERTLY SEXY MASTERPIECE! to summarise yes i smell all the notes, its mostly a dark creamy patchouli with tobacco undercurrent- it gives me a dark, mysterious but comforting forest vibe. u must like patchouli to appreciate this, its the PERFECT dark patchouli! corroborating another review it does give initio side effect vibes bc of how dark it is and i often layer them both together. The tobacco smells like herod. The dry down is incredible, the apple and nutmeg facets give it so much depth and nuance its one of the best things ive ever smelt. i cannot relate to these negative reviews, if its harsh upon first spray just give it a minute damn<br />
<br />
It is masculine yes but the creaminess makes it wearable for me as a girl- im unable to do this with for eg layton bc it has stereotypical masculine freshness - this just doesnt, the darkness does not make it inherently masculine imo just mysterious and i like smelling dark. i have worn this in every season, day and night, it may not be versatile on paper but i made it versatile bc i literaly grab it for every occassion without a second thought  its perfect in piercing cold and also in thick heat; i wear this with anything from elegant feminine dresses to leather jackets, to anywhere from grocery stores to nature activities u name it, daily; whenever i try wearing anything different i feel unsettled and jealous that im not wearing this- thats what u call an actual chokehold. i also have car sickness and wearing this actually helps me not vomit <br />
<br />
it lasts all day on me and projects very strongly, i usually layer with grand soir and people smell me from 10ft away (with or without grand soir), COMPLIMENTS GALORE, nothing has given me compliments from strangers the way this hasthis replaced ombre leather for compliments winner BY A MILE. its honestly the reason i still get laid with this god-awful personality</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2117855"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2117855#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2117822" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2113178" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="PK_thundr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2060445"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="PK_thundr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/XJ-1861-Naxos-30529.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30529.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="XJ 1861 Naxos"title="XJ 1861 Naxos"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2113178ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2113178" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2060445">PK_thundr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-03">04/03/24 11:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Extremely masculine, could not see a woman ever wearing this. I get a leathery accord even though it isn't listed as a note. The opening is a bit too much for me, but the dry down is wonderful and musky. The patchouli in the drydown is so good. The patchouli note in here is reminiscent of the type of patchouli in sauvage, but obviously much much better. <br />
You'll want to keep smelling where you sprayed it over and over again. <br />
The only downside is versatility, I'm not sure if this is something I could rock all day, but I'd definitely want to get a 10ml decant of this to wear on special occasions, nights out, or even on dates.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1949338">MrMrBrian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-29">03/29/24 10:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wasnt going to ever speak on this, But just thought Why Not? I ordered official carded samples of this thru Fragrancenet &amp; was in complete awe of this!! For me &amp; my taste &amp; all the frags I own. I knew after years Id found myself a new signature scent, One I could wear a lot &amp; just repeat buy!! So of course seen the best deal on Fragrancenet &amp; purchased with full presentation &amp; to this day not worried about its authenticity. But when pulling that beautiful black bottle out the box &amp; spraying all I got was really harsh sharp patchouli!! NOTHING ELSE WHATSOEVER!! Except I dont know? Water??? To the point it wasnt even a fragrance.. I own both Jovoy Psychedelique &amp; Profumum Patchouly which are very similar. This I recieved is a really watered down version of those..I dont wanna turn this into a Fragrancenet review by any means, I have a friend who sales vast amounts of niche fragrances on eBay &amp; He said dont bother sending it back &amp; buying one of his. He stated he noticed a difference in his as well &amp; told me theyre the same batchcode &amp; a lot of sellers bought lots of these cheap &amp; thats why were selling them for $220 instead of $359!! Time has gone by &amp; I can pull this one shake it spray the hell out of it &amp; it there are no notes, Just a harsh patchouli scent that disappears an a lil over an hour no many how many times it blasts out the wonderful atomizer! This is another example of what some of these big niche companies know they can get away with to make that much more money.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2107959"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2107959#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2107886" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2107886"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2107886#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2107541" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2107541" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ElliotAlderson1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1916556"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1916556.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ElliotAlderson1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2107541ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2107541" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.8); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1916556">ElliotAlderson1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-28">03/28/24 23:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At the end of the day reviews and other peoples opinions mean nothing. If you like the fragrance great if you think it smells like the most vile thing ever concocted cool everyone is entitled to their opinion. Niche perfume isnt for everyone. I look at it as you could love a fragrance and have 50% of people love it yourself included and the other 50% hate it or wear a npc designer like sauvage edt and have everyone like it. Perfume isnt about making everyone like you its about making yourself confident. This perfume has very very mixed reviews i love it and got an amazing deal someone might smell it hate it see retail price and think this is overpriced garbage. Everyone is different. Thank you to anyone who reads this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2107541"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2107541#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2106408" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2106408" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ginandrice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246357"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1246357.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ginandrice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aesop/Hwyl-46895.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46895.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hwyl"title="Hwyl"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2106408ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2106408" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246357">ginandrice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-27">03/27/24 19:41</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Carlisle is sweet like warm, golden vanilla with subtle fruity undertones. There's a slightly-musty-green woodiness to it, and a pleasantly chewy texture. <br />
<br />
It's warm, easy-going, and casually masculine.<br />
<br />
I knew immediately that it reminded me of something but it took me a few minutes to figure out what. I really did <i>not</i> expect the answer to be Mugler Angel, but here we are. <br />
<br />
Carlisle's prominent tonka bean note has a warm, leathery, caramel-ish sweetness, likely thanks to the vanilla, opoponax, and osmanthus. When paired with the grassy, hay-like patchouli, it's like a mellower, quieter, "His" version of a his-and-hers set, with Angel EDP as the wilder, louder, "Hers" version.  <br />
<br />
When this couple goes to the county fair, he plays a few games of ring toss, wins her a small stuffed bear, gets a little handsy at the top of the Ferris wheel (for old time's sake), and then takes himself off to the rodeo with a comfortable number of beer tickets to last the afternoon. Meanwhile she goes on every ride twice, eats a caramel apple and a candy apple back to back, invents names for all the exhibit animals, wins a giant basket-toss prize using the trick her uncle taught her, then runs into three of their friends and drags them all back to the rodeo where they reconvene with her hubby (who was just beginning to tire of solitary spectating) and proceed to drink beer and cheer loudly for whichever horse "seems the nicest."</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2106408"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2106408#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2105477" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2105477" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="foundri"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1572655"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1572655.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="foundri" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2105477ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2105477" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1572655">foundri</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-27">03/27/24 00:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>wow, ive never had to scrub off a fragrance, ever. until now, usually its fine, oh this doesnt smell good whatever it will come off. carlisle violated and assaulted my nose, mercilessly. i couldnt go noseblind, it doesnt go away. i just scrubbed it off for 5 minutes with soap and its still lingering strongly. i am reading these reviews thinking my nose is broken but no, this smells like dirt and ashes shoved down your throat with no warning, the vanilla doesnt help either</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2105477"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2105477#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2103199" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2103199" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="astralmonad870"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1555935.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="astralmonad870" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dries-Van-Noten/Jardin-de-L-Orangerie-72594.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72594.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Jardin de L'Orangerie"title="Jardin de L'Orangerie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2103199ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2103199" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1555935">astralmonad870</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-24">03/24/24 21:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I own a dupe of this by Noted Aromas which is creamier and more unisex than the original. An intoxicating scent</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2103199"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2103199#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2102549" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2102549" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MrSerious96"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1471068"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="MrSerious96" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.33514.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Carlisle"title="Carlisle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2102549ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2102549" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1471068">MrSerious96</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-24">03/24/24 07:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Carlisle is an absolute Masterpiece and is one of my most favorite fragrances! It is a wonderfully modern and masculine gourmand fragrance that is exceptionally well crafted with very high quality raw materials.<br />
<br />
The fragrance itself is richly thick, luxurious, sweet, clean, well balanced, slightly spicy with a subtle herbaceous touch and mysterious. It defies simple deconstruction and understanding and it still manages to amaze me with new facets every so often.<br />
<br />
The scent doesn't change dramatically throughout it duration and just starts to gradually fade in intensity and complexity.<br />
The scent in it's greatest splendor has a clean, thick patchouli sweetness that can be compared to TF Black Orchid, without the earthier facets, that is masterfully complemented by beautiful vanilla, coumarin and rich sweet amber note (opoponax according to the producer). This sweet core is then balanced with a subtly herbaceous and bitter note (davana) accompanied by a fresh nutmeg and leathery saffron that help in creating a balanced contrast to the sweetness of the fragrance. This is probably the reason for the presence of a tobacco note that seems to be present. There also seems to be a slight juicy plum accord that is created by the interplay ingredients. There is some freshness to the fragrance probably as a consequence of apple acetates but it lingers in the background and doesn't stick out. You would also be hard pressed to identify a rose in this but it seems to be present nevertheless and gives it this vibrantly luxurious floral core that complements the clean, dry and rich sweetness of the fragrance and gives it a very elegant feel. I don't really detect wood in this formula.<br />
<br />
The longevity, projection and sillage are outstanding even in the new batches (2023), since it lasts for well over 10 hours with more than an arm's lenght projection for the first 3-4 hours with about half an arm's lenght projection after that. It stays as a skin scent for more than 12 hours. This is skin dependent and on my skin (light) it performs exceptionally well. It should perform well on darker skin types as well due to the utilisation of musks that make it latch on to the skin very well. It is a very robust and well performing fragrance even though that it has been watered down slightly since their reformulation.<br />
<br />
This is absolutely a cold weather fragrance that is suitable for formal as well as more informal occasions. It does pay to be dressed up for this one. The ladies absolutely love it and it pulls compliments. <br />
<br />
It is unisex or more masculine, but it could be pulled of by a woman.<br />
<br />
It's absolutely worth the price because of the perfumer's skills and high quality of raw materials that include a lot of naturals which is apparent in its amber color (no colorings added).The DNA has been replicated by Mancera:Red Tobacco, but there is a very big difference in the skill and ingredients used. Parfums de Marley are an exceptional perfume house that has created many amazing fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2102549"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2102549#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2102384" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2102384" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="erayikari"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2069762"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2069762.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="erayikari" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Initio-Parfums-Prives/Rehab-50351.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50351.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rehab"title="Rehab"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2102384ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2102384" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2069762">erayikari</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-24">03/24/24 01:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>favori kokularmdan biri gizemli karanlk ayn zamanda tatl kokulara baylrm bu kokuda yine tatl ama baymaz fresh bir yan da var reine gibi deil muskat ve yeil elma alta etkili bu kokuda notalarda olmasa bile vine ve ttn havas var vanilya tonka faslyesi ve pauli ok etkili inanlmaz seksi ve inanlmaz gizemli bir koku</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2100637" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="StinkyRetard"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2016312"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="StinkyRetard" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2100637ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2100637" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.79); Reminds me of all the other vanilla and spicy frags popping up now a days. Mix paco rabanne 1 million and le male elixir and you aren't far from this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2100637"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2100637#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2099056" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
