align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2099056"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2099056#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2097265" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2097265" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fragcentral"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/913757"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.913757.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fragcentral" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Haltane-70776.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70776.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Haltane"title="Haltane"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2097265ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2097265" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/913757">fragcentral</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-19">03/19/24 08:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I love this one.  It gives you a feeling of majesty.  Great longevity and projection for me.  It's hard to say what notes I'm detecting, but it smells like a nice creamy tobacco.  Very refined.  Definitely in the vein of Red Tobacco.  10/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2097265"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2097265#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2094204" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2094204" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="traublee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2051087"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2051087.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="traublee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2094204ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2094204" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2051087">traublee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-16">03/16/24 05:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Carlisle is the first PdM fragrance I've tried. Picked up a small sample because curiosity got the best of me and it was "godly". My first initial spraying wasn't exactly something I was looking for - it was very medicinal, almost like a cough syrup. It took me a while to build up any love for it but now it is one of my tops from the house of PdM. Love the sweetness of the opening, the very prominent green apple note, incredibly fruity, little boozy; as it continued developing, a strong almost woodsy-vanilla kicked in making this absolutely stunning. <br />
<br />
The longevity is there, the sillage could be a lot better but overall, incredible scent for a cold weather/a night out.<br />
Rating: 9/10;</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2094204"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2094204#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2091686" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2091686" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="colsn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1968306"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1968306.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="colsn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2091686ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2091686" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1968306">colsn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-13">03/13/24 14:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells identical to a hospital this is just disgusting<br />
<br />
5/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2091686"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2091686#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2091269" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2091269" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="edstyler"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1512544"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1512544.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="edstyler" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Homme-Ideal-Eau-de-Parfum-37735.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37735.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="LHomme Ideal Eau de Parfum"title="LHomme Ideal Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2091269ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2091269" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1512544">edstyler</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-13">03/13/24 08:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>What a beautiful fragrance this is, I'm honestly thrilled, but I must mention that I didn't have this opinion the first time I tested it; it felt somehow heavy and dark to me.<br />
<br />
Now that I've purchased it after several tests, it suits me perfectly. It has beautiful and quality notes that are perfectly rounded. Herod has much more hype, but it just doesn't suit me at all; firstly, it lasts extremely poorly with no projection whatsoever, and secondly, I'm not a big fan of tobacco.<br />
<br />
This Carlisle is my favorite from PdM, and after it comes Layton and Oajan. Rating from me: 10/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2091269"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2091269#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2090955" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2090955" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Voltagelol"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2055507"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Voltagelol" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Isola-Blu-80177.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.80177.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Isola Blu"title="Isola Blu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2090955ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2090955" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2055507">Voltagelol</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-13">03/13/24 00:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Carlisle was my first niche fragrance full bottle purchase. I will admit, I was very naive and uninformed within the niche world. I almost solely relied on fragrantica ratings and price as a guide to the 'objective' quality of a fragrance. I intellectualised my search, and believe I could transcend subjectivity to find the 'ideal' fragrance.<br />
<br />
This being said, I idealised Carlisle as the 'scent of the gods' for quite some time, believing myself superior for having researched my way to the ideal fragrance. I enjoyed it, as it was clearly higher quality than the designer shit I'd smelled beforehand, and it was so heavy, so rich, so unique: truly 'niche', as was I for having discovered it. I wore it as my office scent for months on end, and it gave me an irreproachable confidence. <br />
<br />
Looking back, I feel so dumb. The stuff smells okay, but it's just a fragrance. I built my entire image around this stuff. I actually have other perfumes I prefer now, and I find this stuff so incredibly strong - especially the patchouli. I also live in Australia and I really need to save it for the cold days, and one or 2 sprays max at that. Certainly wouldn't wear it to the office unless it was a special occassion. <br />
<br />
TLDR: It is good if you like heavy, rich, sophisticated fragrances for winter that make you stand out, but it's very strong so go easy on the sprays. Also, patchouli. Make sure you like patchouli as if you don't you will quickly grow to resent this fragrance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2090955"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2090955#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2090120" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2090120" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Wabdo_7"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1870089"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1870089.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Wabdo_7" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Emporio-Armani-Stronger-With-You-Absolutely-64501.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64501.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Emporio Armani Stronger With You Absolutely"title="Emporio Armani Stronger With You Absolutely"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2090120ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2090120" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1870089">Wabdo_7</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-12">03/12/24 07:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I like Carlisle, but its missing an extra something. This fragrance has a heavy saffron opening that may put many people off, but to me its sexy and the apple adds a nice feel to it, and then it dries down to a calm vanilla and patchouli which i find boring, this to me is like a less jammy and boring smoking hot.<br />
<br />
scent 7.7/10<br />
longevity: 8.5/10 (i get around 8 hours or so)<br />
sillage: 7.8/10 (it projects at an arms length for maybe 2-3 hours after that you just get small whiffs of it)<br />
overall 8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2090120"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2090120#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088967" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2088967" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Trevor44454444"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2053172"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Trevor44454444" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Fabulous-Yuzu-75731.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75731.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fabulous Yuzu"title="Fabulous Yuzu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2088967ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2088967" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2053172">Trevor44454444</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-11">03/11/24 07:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>. My cousin got this for me and ima jus say it straight.<br />
<br />
my cousin has through a lot in his life and he also has autism and something called down syndrom i think so the plug is kinda disabled. <br />
<br />
I asked very kindly for Parfums de Marley Oajan AND Parfums de Marley Greenley and this guy got me this ball sweat typa scent...<br />
<br />
<br />
It kinda reminds me of Jean Paul Gaultier le male Elixir. It has that ball sweat type opening and dries down to some sweet ice cream. <br />
<br />
but at the same time it gives me that Azzaro Chrome typa feeling bc it was one of the only scents that made my nose AND balls go crazy<br />
<br />
<br />
Now the real question is, Would i wear this? Idk maybe if i was batman, Harry Jackson Smith Carol or Playboi Carti then probably yes<br />
<br />
scent 4/10<br />
longevity: 10/10<br />
projection:10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2088967"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2088967#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088949" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2088949" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gaboich"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1984964"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gaboich" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Oajan-21548.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21548.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oajan"title="Oajan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2088949ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2088949" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1984964">Gaboich</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-11">03/11/24 07:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To everyone reading this. I realized my mistake.<br />
At the end of the day everyone is human.<br />
<br />
 by the weight of my hasty judgment and a nose that has, perhaps, matured in its olfactory sensibilities. There was a time when I dismissed you as a scent that resembled the unpleasant aroma of feces, a judgment fueled by a fleeting encounter that failed to capture your true essence.<br />
<br />
In those early days, my nose was unrefined, inexperienced, and perhaps a touch arrogant in its dismissal of the complexities that make a fragrance truly remarkable. I allowed my initial impression to overshadow the layers of notes that you harbored, dismissing the potential for a harmonious symphony that could unfold upon a more patient and appreciative encounter.<br />
<br />
As time passed, I found myself revisiting you, reluctantly at first, but with an open mind and a newfound humility. To my surprise and delight, the olfactory journey that unfolded revealed a fragrance that transcended my initial, hasty judgment. The notes that I had once considered offensive transformed into a captivating blend, unveiling an intricate dance of scents that spoke of sophistication, depth, and subtlety.<br />
<br />
I stand before you now, humble and contrite, ready to acknowledge the error of my initial assessment. It was not you who smelled like excrement; it was my own lack of understanding and appreciation for the artistry that goes into crafting a complex fragrance. I apologize for my rash words and misguided perception.<br />
<br />
May this letter serve as a testament to the ever-evolving nature of our senses and the valuable lesson learned  that beauty, much like fragrance, is often found in the layers that unfold with time and patience<br />
<br />
With sincere apologies, Parfums de marley Carlisle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2088949"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2088949#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088672" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2088672" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="blackjack3"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2052124"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2052124.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="blackjack3" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2088672ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2088672" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2052124">blackjack3</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-10">03/10/24 23:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very dark patchouli. If you dont like patchouli you definitely wont like this.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2088672"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2088672#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2088658" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2088658" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Kyer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1842538"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1842538.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Kyer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/The-Harmonist/Hypnotizing-Fire-36700.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.36700.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hypnotizing Fire"title="Hypnotizing Fire"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2088658ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2088658" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1842538">Kyer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-10">03/10/24 22:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is what Red Tobacco aspired to be but couldnt. <br />
<br />
Out of the 3 fragrances with similar DNA (Triumph of Bacchus, Red Tobacco and Carlisle) this is definitely the best one. Its leagues above the other 2 that Id even say its not similar to them at all.<br />
<br />
Classy gentleman scent, dark, mysterious and perfectly balanced sweetness.<br />
<br />
Probably my favorite PdM at the moment.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2088658"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2088658#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2087572" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2079316" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Actxq"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1774474"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1774474.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Actxq" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/L-Immensite-49751.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49751.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="LImmensit "title="LImmensit "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2079316ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2079316" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1774474">Actxq</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-03-01">03/01/24 15:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just got this, opening is heavy on the nutmeg and apple. dries down into parfum de Marlys beautiful signature vanilla and patchouli scent. Very well crafted, however i wish it lasted longer. I have a reformulated batch, lasts around 6 hours on skin. If you can get it for under $150 go for it, but I wouldnt pay more because of the performance.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2079316"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2079316#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2078469" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; When i got to the office, i always asked them about my frags when i wore something that i never wore it to the office.<br />

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2077805" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="andypatton"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1906526"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1906526.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="andypatton" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Michael-Malul-London/Ocean-Noir-70722.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70722.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ocean Noir"title="Ocean Noir"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2077805ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2077805" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1906526">andypatton</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-29">02/29/24 07:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@icecore I appreciate your response and your thoughts on the fragrance. Absolutely, there are many factors that go into the performance, I agree.<br />
I do have a couple of performers (Sauvage, Ombre Leather) and, to me, Id add Carlisle to the group. I hear you about your percentage concerns. For me personally, Carlisle lasts not only on my skin, but with silage for several hours. Not sure why that is except, as you said, everyone is different, which is absolutely true. With 11 sprays or so, perhaps you might be going slightly noseblind? Im sure you considered that though, especially if your coworker is unable to smell it. Anyway, I appreciate the exchange and hope you have a great day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2077805"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2077805#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2077493" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2077493" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="icecore"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1824773"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1824773.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="icecore" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Ambre-Sultan-2760.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2760.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ambre Sultan"title="Ambre Sultan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2077493ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2077493" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1824773">icecore</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-28">02/28/24 23:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@andypatton not a needless distraction, but its to stop misleading buyer who gonna buy this frag hoping they gonna get a beast performance from the reviews in here. The words beast and enormous are overused nowadays, and to make it worse, lots of people only judge the performance based on the initial sprays, spur of the moment hype, and when they smell it on themselves. The projection on my Carlisle(s) dies on me pretty fast under 1h, and only has moderate to strong projection, i cant say much about the vintage batch tho. Yeah the smell lasts on my skin for another few hours, but it doesnt project anymore when passed 1h mark, it turned to faint whisper.<br />
<br />
Usually i judge the performance from the people around me, mostly my admins at the office. Whenever i used a frag, i always asked them when i sat next to them, "can u smell it?" My distance with 1 of my admins only around 60cm, so if within that range she cant smell me, i considerate it as weak, and that frag only relies on sillage for other people to smell it. Also i always use the same amount of sprays, before i used 10 sprays, now i use 11 sprays, so its easy for me to gauge the performance of my frags.<br />
<br />
I have a few performers from my little collection, maybe u can see it on my profile. Such as Ganymede and Promise on EDP concentration, my admin could smell it easily, and she could still smell it easily for the next 3-4h. Looking at ur profile, u dont have a strong performer, so its normal if u think the 81% batch is enormous.<br />
<br />
But since frag is subjective, i dont blame anyone for any review in here. There are several factors that could affect a frag, such as weather, bottle, batch (not vintage vs 81%, but more like natural ingredients have various strengths between each batch), skin chemistry, etc. Im simply stating my personal experience with this frag from 2 batches that i tried, but looks like some fan boys in here cant take my words with grain of salt and downvoting my review. Some even quoted what i wrote lol<br />
<br />
But im glad Carlisle works for u, Andy. Its a beautiful frag, i really adore this that made me bought 2 different batches on the 81%. Too bad the performance doesnt work well on me. Defo not my skin chemistry, bc i tested it on shirt too.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2077493"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2077493#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2076025" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Its enormous and lasts well into the night on my skin. 81% vs 78% is a needless distraction IMO. According to the batch code, my bottle is about 9 months old and it is an absolute beast.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2076025"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2076025#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2074483" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1895428">Yohanes27</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-26">02/26/24 06:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I got a small sample of Carlisle.<br />
Immediately reminds me of Layton, but a sweeter and more dense. While I like the scent very much, I also really like Layton, and imo it is redundant to have both. My choice would still be Layton (or the dupe of it) since it is easier to use in multiple occasions.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2074483"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2074483#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2069050" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2069050" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Arsenal Till I Die"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/866507"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.866507.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Arsenal Till I Die" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2069050ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2069050" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/866507">Arsenal Till I Die</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-21">02/21/24 01:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Unpopular opinion, Mancera - red tobacco kills this and all the other similar scents like triumph of baccas etc I dont even like Mancera..</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1992810">RifleZz</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-19">02/19/24 01:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One of the best PDM-s out there, for sure.<br />
I have tried the new formulation and it's still really good (the scent is still a 10 / 10 with well above average performance and projection, I have to say that it still has that power and strenght of the OG Carlisile and that it can fill up a room :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2066480" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bizzy1995"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1963702"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bizzy1995" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Allure-Homme-523.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.523.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Allure Homme"title="Allure Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2066480ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2066480" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1963702">Bizzy1995</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-02-18">02/18/24 16:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Warm Vanilla and Nutmeg is the first notes I smell when I put my nose to this when the alcohol dries off. As I continue to smell i pick up the saffron and Tonka which adds a creamy sweetness. The patchouli helps tone down the sweetness and adds a woodiness that balances it , without this I think it would be cloying. <br />
<br />
Words to describe this: warm, sweet, woody, resinous, creamy<br />
<br />
Not my favorite PDM</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2066480"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2066480#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2065157" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2055487" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chowder.man"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1958462"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1958462.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="chowder.man" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2055487ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2055487" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.72); If you want this type of smell but less masculine, get yourself a bottle of Maple Cedar by Daniel Josier. I own a bottle of it and it smells super similar to this but more light/floral and less patchouli-focused.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2055487"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2055487#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2048569" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; I bought a 125ml bottle of it, and I loved it still. However, after about an hour of it the dry down started to smell repulsive I wouldnt have called it that at first because of how much I thought I loved it and for how much it was. Today, I hate it. It smells like how pepto bismol and Walmart brand Pepcid taste: like chalk.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2039614"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2039614#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2035730" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2035730" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Glyph"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1312716.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Glyph" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Santal-Majuscule-15547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Santal Majuscule"title="Santal Majuscule"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2035730ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2035730" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1312716">Glyph</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-19">01/19/24 10:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a more complex scent than most other PdMs I've owned or tried: it opens with a harsh blast of apple and nutmeg, but then quiets down towards a more pleasing accord where the sweeter notes (the tonka and the vanilla) and the dark patchouli enter into the mix. The closer you smell your skin, the more evident also become the smoky, church-like note of opoponax and the tangy saffron, making the accord smell more Middle Eastern.<br />
<br />
This is a highly pleasing winter fragrance, and a lot of thought seems to have gone into this. PdM is always on the pricey side for me, but at least here they're trying to give you what you're paying for.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2035730"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2035730#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2033743" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2033743" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stievenko"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/314167"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.314167.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stievenko" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2033743ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2033743" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/314167">stievenko</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-17">01/17/24 11:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p> I uSeD 10 SpRaYS aND it dOEsNT PrOJEct <br />
 77% iS SO mUCh BETTeR bRO tHEY mESSeD it UP <br />
<br />
I have:<br />
2015 sample<br />
2023 bottle<br />
<br />
Still deep, rich and alluring. Still 4 hours of strong projection and 10+ hours longevity. Still worth Evert penny. <br />
<br />
Red Tabacco seems similar at first but if you wear them a few times they feel different enough to have them both. Carlisle is a patchouili based scent while RT is more on the Tabacco. Also feels spicier in the beginning with that synthetic Mancera/Montale vibe. Both great but depending on what you want I'd say PdM is more interesting and back the Mancera is unbeatable value.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2033743"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2033743#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2033526" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2033526" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maxpowerboston"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089734"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1089734.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maxpowerboston" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2033526ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2033526" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089734">maxpowerboston</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-17">01/17/24 06:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I had a decant from 2018. And I had a bottle with a batch code from 2020 (got it in late 2020). Bottle was 77% (as I assume the decant was, too). I can tell you with absolute certainty the 2018 decant was richer, deeper, and the green apple note lasted far longer than my bottle from 2020. I could smell the 2018 on a scarf weeks later. Not true of the 2020. I tried a 2022 batch 81% from the counter at Neiman Marcus and that smelled identical to the 2020 bottle I had. So, I'm not sure it's the concentration as much as some other formula tweaks they did. I hate to be batch guy, because I think it's often overblown, but in this situation it's pretty apparent things shifted. <br />
<br />
When people wax poetic on Carlisle, I always feels it's the older batches (same with Layton and Herod). I own first year Layton and Herod and those are better than what I smell today. Similar, obviously, but denser and richer. I would've argued it's just oxidation causing the change but the 2018 to 2020 Carlise difference was so apparent that I can't imagine that's the case.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2033526"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2033526#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2030186" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2030186" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="WeezyPipes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1764595"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1764595.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="WeezyPipes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Aventus-9828.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.9828.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aventus"title="Aventus"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2030186ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2030186" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1764595">WeezyPipes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-13">01/13/24 19:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Carlisle smells like a Cuban cigar-flavored disposable vape I bought at the Miami airport. Not fresh out of the wrapper but discovered nearly dead weeks after my trip, stinking up my bag. I find it synthetic and cloying, nauseating even. I like Herod and Habdan much better.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2030186"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2030186#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2028902" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
