align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2027786"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2027786#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2026757" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2026757" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alitunc13"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1902943"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="alitunc13" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Bond-No-9/The-Scent-of-Peace-for-Him-20551.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.20551.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Scent of Peace for Him"title="The Scent of Peace for Him"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2026757ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2026757" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1902943">alitunc13</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-10">01/10/24 12:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I absolutely hated this fragrance when I first tried it. I thought it was just another tiktok hyped fragrance. I am glad that I decided to give it another chance because I truly fell in love with the scent. Even though I think I am not fully mature enough to pull this smell off, I don't care. I'd wear this on a hot summer day, on a cold winter day, for a special occasion, or to the gym. I think it throws people off when you first smell it due to its dark/mysterious DNA, but this fragrance is truly a masterpiece. 100% worth the price and the hype. Fully recommend.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2026757"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2026757#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2023225" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2023225" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Christos08"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816892"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Christos08" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2023225ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2023225" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816892">Christos08</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-07">01/07/24 03:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Carlisle is a masterpiece pure and simple it is the perfect autumn winter fragrance and blended to pure perfection I love everything that parfums de marly do in the fragrance world from the fragrances themselves to the bottles and packaging. For me the majority of them have a creaminess that you won't find anywhere else. I have tried to narrow down the top 3 PDM fragrances I own them all and it is virtually impossible because they create fragrances based on mood that's my belief. Some days I want to feel like Carlisle warm spicy comforting and other days warm and fresh like Layton or kalan I love the brand and as long as they make fragrance and I'm able to buy them I will. I recently got married and I wore althair it's something that will stay with me forever that's what great fragrance can do for you and PDM deliver 100%</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2023225"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2023225#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2021259" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2021259" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mystinguette"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178543"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1178543.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mystinguette" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/La-Fille-de-Berlin-17162.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17162.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Fille de Berlin"title="La Fille de Berlin"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2021259ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2021259" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1178543">Mystinguette</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-05">01/05/24 08:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Carlisle is a sexy, alluring scent, not for the faint of heart. This is a fragrance connoisseur's scent, not that it's necessary to be a connoisseur to appreciate its beauty. It's completely unique and is a welcome addition to any fragrance collection. I admit, when I smelled Carlisle for the first time, I had mixed feelings about it. I wasn't certain that I liked it, however, I did find it intriguing. I purchased a decant and gave myself time to live with it for a while. As time passed, it grew on me more and more, and after one week's time, I really liked it. I still don't love it but I appreciate its beauty. At this time I wouldn't purchase a full bottle. Perhaps in time I will, there is no rush. I love nutmeg as a note in perfumes if used correctly, and it's used to full advantage in Carlisle. I'd swear that oud is in the composition, perhaps a light, clean oud. Not a skanky one. Oud isn't listed in the composition, however, it may still be in there. The osmanthus and opoponax could be tricking my nose into believing that oud's in there somewhere. Frankly, I'm glad this doesn't contain heavy oud because if so, we'd have something akin to Roses Greedy (which I don't care for). In my opinion, this isn't a safe blind buy. For many reasons and chief among those reasons is the hefty price tag, and the scent itself. Definitely purchase a decant and give yourself the opportunity to live with it for a period of time before investing in a full bottle. Fine fragrance is like fine wine. You must open it up and allow it to breathe to fully appreciate its beauty. This is blended to perfection and there is nothing like it in my collection. The closest thing I own, perhaps, is MFK Oud Satin Mood. They really don't smell alike, they are in a similar vein and evoke a similar mood. I like Oud Satin Mood better, however. Exploring the world of beautiful niche fragrances is such a delightful undertaking. It brings me such joy and inner peace. Enjoy!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2021259"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2021259#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2021137" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2021137" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="wldnml"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1873457"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="wldnml" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2021137ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2021137" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1873457">wldnml</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-05">01/05/24 06:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first it may feel sharp and too dominant, but after 30 mins it becomes beautiful, masculine. I love how it reminds me of Layton but still different with some added dark notes. Stays on clothes for more than 2 days. Gives me some slight almond, tobacco, smokey vibes as well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2021137"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2021137#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2020981" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2020981" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="0xrafae"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1544521"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1544521.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="0xrafae" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2020981ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2020981" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1544521">0xrafae</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-01-05">01/05/24 03:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For some reason, I'm picking up cinnamon notes set against a sweet vanilla background in Carlilse. It results in a pleasantly sweet feeling, but I'm not getting the 'darkness' that others talk about, so it might not be the go-to frag for Darth Vader but perhaps for Edward Scissorhands  a bit quirky, yet sweet?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; Pm me</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2015587"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2015587#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2013797" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2013797" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ZiggySmellsGood"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1446651"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1446651.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ZiggySmellsGood" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2013797ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2013797" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1446651">ZiggySmellsGood</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-28">12/28/23 22:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A very warm and smooth Middle Eastern fragrance. This is one of my favorites in my collection  and definitely my favorite from the house of Parfums De Marley. I understand how maybe the opening could be compared to Mancera Red Tobacco but the vanilla, tonka and clean musks take this masterpiece another direction . This one dries down to almost a gourmand fragrance imo . Its funny tobacco is not listed in the notes but yet so many comment on how they smell tobacco and I agree but only maybe for a little bit in the opening. I also have had people tell me that they pick up a tobacco note when I where Layton . Either way this has a beautiful opening but its not all about the opening with this one, it morphs on your skin throughout the day turning into a creamy spicy vanilla scent that is intoxicating. Its very dark, sexy and elegant.<br />
10/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2013797"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2013797#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2010349" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2009034" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Flamingophil"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262104"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Flamingophil" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Diesel/Only-The-Brave-5532.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5532.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Only The Brave"title="Only The Brave"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2009034ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2009034" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1262104">Flamingophil</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-23">12/23/23 14:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've been meaning to try this fragrance for so long as have heard really good reviews, got to test it today in harrods and wasn't to sure at first sniff but throughout the day I just kept smelling it on myself and now i love this! I sprayed it on myself three times in the morning and could still smell it strongly before I went to bed late that night, fair enough this is expensive but to me it's so worth it as it smells so smooth and expensive when it drys down, will defo recommend and will be adding this to my collection soon as I get the money</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2009034"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2009034#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2008555" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2004599"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2004599#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2004162" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2004162" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bertes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1471128"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bertes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Omnia-Profumi/Argento-13808.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13808.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Argento"title="Argento"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2004162ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2004162" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1471128">Bertes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-18">12/18/23 05:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Complex dark and intense, but a too spicy and smokey for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2004162"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2004162#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2001701" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2001701" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="St.0cky"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1927431"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1927431.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="St.0cky" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2001701ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2001701" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1927431">St.0cky</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-15">12/15/23 01:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Carlisle is a masterpiece in my book. <br />
 A lot of people like to hate on PdM as far as their marketing, the pricing etc.  That's fair.  Although with social media the way it is nowadays, I'd challenge people to name a brand in this day and age that doesn't market that way.  If you were to create a brand today you'd be a fool not to use influencers.  And pricing..well that's just charging what people are willing to pay.  Pricing is relative, and taste in fragrances are subjective. It goes hand in hand. <br />
<br />
But hate PdM or not, one thing I cannot agree with people on is calling it a clone house, or a niche house charging high prices for "designer frags" with slightly better quality materials.  That is asinine, as I challenge people to tell me what frag Herod, Carlisle, Oajan, Kalan, Godolphin is copying?  Sure there may be similarities, but that is a rabbit hole that goes too deep.  In the end, all frags have similarities. But PdM makes unique well blended juice imho.  <br />
<br />
As for Carlisle, the scent is fantastic.   <br />
It's dark, smoky (although there's no tobacco note), a little sweet with the vanilla and the tonka. Carlisle is exactly what I got into Niche for.  I was tired of smelling designer frags that almost all seem to be regurgitating the same profiles with subtle spins.  Carlisle is an absolute beast frag. It goes well over 12 hours on me.  Ive had Carlisle on in the morning after a shower, went to work for the day, went home and showered. Hit the gym.  Went home to eat and then gone to the pool.  And then radiated Carlisle while in the pool.  Hop out the pool and quick shower, head home and eat and I'm sitting there still smelling Carlisle.  It is pretty wild and baffles me. <br />
<br />
I got Carlisle at a discount for $189.99 so to me it is worth it at this price.  It is one of my favorite frags, probably top 5.  <br />
Would I pay the full retail price of almost $400?  Heck no.  But that goes for any frag for me.  <br />
<br />
Just like any frag, I really never suggest people blind buy.  Unless it's like a $40 frag where getting a sample/decant would be less than practical.  So get a sample and try it out. Most importantly, don't be one of these fools that just smell something at the counter at Nordstrom or Sephora through the bottle's sprayer or on a test strip.  WEAR it!   That is the only way to have a fair assessment of any frag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2001701"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2001701#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2000540" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2000540" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hundci"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/100438"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hundci" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2000540ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2000540" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/100438">hundci</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-13">12/13/23 16:20</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The begining is a bit too sweet for me. Almost a pass for me due to its candy vibe at the start. And that start can last almost a full hour sometimes. BUT, once it gets past that, it becomes an amazing warm, cozy and elegant scent. It does have a multi personality problem for sure since it tends to transform into 3-4 different vibes, but apart from the sweet one at the begining, I love all of its other alter egos.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="2000540"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=2000540#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1998272" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1998272" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="anthonyrj"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/24934"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.24934.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="anthonyrj" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Brioni/Brioni-Eau-de-Parfum-66300.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66300.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Brioni Eau de Parfum"title="Brioni Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1998272ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1998272" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/24934">anthonyrj</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-11">12/11/23 05:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I hate to be the voice of dissent on such a popular fragrance, but I really disliked this scent (and I should know better...I rarely like "hyped" fragrances). To my nose this smells like a spicy, apple pastry. Obviously high quality juice with a high naturals-to-synthetic ratio. Also very long lasting on my skin, but I never want to smell like this. I'd enjoy this as a candle or a room spray, but as a perfume I just don't enjoy it. I'll continue to try it over time to see if it grows on me, but after two months, it's still a hard pass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1998272"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1998272#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1997716" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1997716" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Muskyflower"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740743"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Muskyflower" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1997716ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1997716" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1740743">Muskyflower</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-10">12/10/23 10:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>One reviewer said, "in the drydown this takes on a slight incense vibe (not listed in the accords) but I detect it" <br />
<br />
The incense note is literally listed in the base notes on  the pyramid: <br />
It is called "opoponax" which is literally a resinous incense like myrrh....</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1997716"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1997716#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1997701" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1997701" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Shadow97"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1569148"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Shadow97" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Costa-Azzurra-64617.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64617.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Costa Azzurra"title="Costa Azzurra"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1997701ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1997701" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1569148">Shadow97</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-10">12/10/23 10:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The most masculine and best scent I've smelled in my life, BUT! its longevity is HORRIBLE, after 3-4 hours it turns into a skin scent.<br />
Parfums De marly, are you serious?!!<br />
Stop reformulating all your fragrances because you will need to close all your shops soon..<br />
It's pathetic that you pay 250 for a scent that lasts a few hours only! :(<br />
PDM never ever in my life again thanks</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1997701"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1997701#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1997548" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1997548" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="icecore"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1824773"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1824773.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="icecore" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Ambre-Sultan-2760.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2760.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ambre Sultan"title="Ambre Sultan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1997548ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1997548" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1824773">icecore</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-10">12/10/23 06:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells so addictive, the sillage on the air is beautiful, but the projection and longetivity is not that good. The projection is moderate and sadly it only lasts for 1h max, then turns to faint whisper. At first i thought i got nose blind, but everyone around me couldnt smell it unless they brought their noses to the spot that i sprayed on. Also the sillage is very hard to perceive after 2h passed.<br />
<br />
Mine is 2022 batch. I used 10 sprays when i wore this, 2 behind each ear, 1 on back neck, 2 on left and right collar bones, and 5 sprays on my shirt (3 on the back, 2 on the front shoulders. Tested it during the hot sunny day (35C),  rainy day (30C), and rainy night (27C). The worst one was during the rainy night, it got muted after 30mins. Also i tried to compare the performance with my friends', 2022 batch (diff batch numbers from mine), and 2021 batch. All didnt have significant difference, 2021 was slightly stronger and lasted a lil bit longer bc it was alr macerated, but not by big margin. <br />
<br />
Such a shame i missed my chance to experience this beautiful frag at it's golden age.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1997548"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1997548#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1996056" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1995689" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rohan1901"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1839283"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="rohan1901" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1995689ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1995689" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1839283">rohan1901</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-08">12/08/23 03:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If Bruce Wayne wore a fragrance, this would be it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1995689"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1995689#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1994823" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1994823" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="viez"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1716159"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1716159.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="viez" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1994823ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1994823" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1716159">viez</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-07">12/07/23 03:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is definitely a beast mode fragrance. Opening is so strong it can be headache inducing if you're not careful. <br />
<br />
As it starts to dry down you can pick up some nuances. The rose and patchouli are very prominent. I'm not picking up much sweetness here, this feels very masculine and mature. <br />
<br />
Not my style unfortunately. I can appreciate it for what it is, but can I see myself wearing this? No. Can I imagine the people around me enjoying the smell? Not particularly.<br />
<br />
Definitely not a safe blind buy. I wouldn't recommend this if you're under 30 years old.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1994823"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1994823#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1993940" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1993940" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Chasen71"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1409950"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Chasen71" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1993940ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1993940" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1409950">Chasen71</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-06">12/06/23 07:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>No rum or tobacco note makes no sense. Top 10 PDM I could wear this anytime but great for colder weather. Immediately I get syrupy Apple and Tobacco. Gourmand beast in the same direction as Angel Share but the Saffron and Patchouli change the path. The Nutmeg and Vanilla are stars in this show upon dry down IMO. Smelling this and wearing this are totally different on me, as the sickly sweet accord calms and the spices shine through. Longevity is amazing and the scent cloud will garner compliments. Due to lack of uniqueness I give it 8/10 but it's still very good.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1993940"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1993940#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1989040" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1989040" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="OwlFactory"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1872873"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1872873.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="OwlFactory" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/L-Homme-Ideal-Eau-de-Parfum-37735.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.37735.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="LHomme Ideal Eau de Parfum"title="LHomme Ideal Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1989040ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1989040" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1872873">OwlFactory</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-30">11/30/23 10:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you like Layton and Herod, but somehow have never smelled Carlisle, you will also like Carlisle. <br />
<br />
I would say it's Layton's older brother or Herod's nephew. <br />
<br />
How Carlisle differs from Layton and Herod is the dry down. After some time it takes on a slight incense vibe (not mentioned in the accords, but I detect it). Nevertheless, it's intoxicating in its own right, but I'm not sure you'd ever need to own all three. <br />
<br />
I can only think of a few scenarios where someone would choose Carlisle over Layton.<br />
<br />
1) You're 40+ and like Layton but it feels too youthful.<br />
2) You've owned Layton for years and want a slight change.<br />
3) You're going to be around someone else who also wears Layton and you want to have a different scent.<br />
<br />
I've heard some people say that Layton + Herod = Carlisle.... and that's one way to look at it, but the tobacco note in Herod is legendary, and not present in L or H. So I wouldn't say that math is accurate.<br />
<br />
This is a 9.5/10 fragrance for me...</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1989040"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1989040#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1985177" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1985177" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Theorgazoid"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1784276"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Theorgazoid" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1985177ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1985177" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1784276">Theorgazoid</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-25">11/25/23 14:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just smells like red tobacco to me. Don't get the hype for this one. Or any PDM. They're all very cloying</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1985177"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1985177#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1984611" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1984611" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="TwoWheelAUS"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1763282"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1763282.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="TwoWheelAUS" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1984611ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1984611" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1763282">TwoWheelAUS</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-24">11/24/23 22:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I appreciate this fragrance even though I don't have an urge to buy a full bottle (a decant has been enough). I get the similarity to Red Tobacco although this is less challenging and it's got more going on. It's sweet, earthy, spicy vanilla. Like dropping a fresh baked gingerbread cookie in the dirt.<br />
<br />
Personally I prefer more gourmand, less spicy fragrances in cold weather. Happy to have tried this though and I appreciate why this is so well loved.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1984611"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1984611#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1984373" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1984373" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mjchaelj"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1330577"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1330577.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mjchaelj" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Trudon/Absolu-96547.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96547.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Absolu"title="Absolu"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1984373ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1984373" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1330577">Mjchaelj</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-24">11/24/23 15:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me this is like a sexier version of Herod. So dark and mysterious but cozy at the same time. Smells like a rich person. Apple, vanilla, nutmeg.  Fantastic!<br />
<br />
9.1/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1984373"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1984373#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1983837" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1983837" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="bryannef"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1828508"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="bryannef" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Dulcis-in-Fundo-3890.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.3890.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dulcis in Fundo"title="Dulcis in Fundo"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1983837ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1983837" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1828508">bryannef</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-23">11/23/23 22:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Opening: dry woodiness and tonka<br />
Drydown: Creamy vanilla saffron bomb. More saffron than vanilla. <br />
<br />
I imagine a very sexy middle eastern man or a very confident woman wearing this in all black. Very edible and inviting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1983837"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1983837#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1981494" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1981494" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Ridge"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1812252"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1812252.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Ridge" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Haltane-70776.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70776.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Haltane"title="Haltane"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1981494ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1981494" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1812252">Ridge</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-20">11/20/23 23:46</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really like this fragrance I think, I blind bought this and when I first sprayed I didn't think I was going to like it. The opening is a little meh. But once it sits, it works magic. Very fine scent. Really like the Tonka and the Rose together. <br />
<br />
This is my second PDM I own (along with Layton), but I have tried others (oajan, herod) and I think that is the case for most PDMs. Opening isn't the best, but the drydown is fire.<br />
<br />
I'm still deciding on how much I like the scent, but right now it's fine. Performance is good like always with PDM.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="33514"comment_id="1981494"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html?ccid=1981494#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="33514" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
